guide.title: Couchbase Lite (Mobile) Tutorial for Android
guide.description: This Couchbase Lite Tutorial is based on Android code written in Eclipse Kepler (IDE) on a MacBook Pro (16 GB RAM), with Couchbase Lite version 1.0.3.1. Throughout the tutorial we will reference screen shots and Java code. If you are using another OS, and IDE or language, we will share more about iOS/Xcode projects in a subsequent tutorial.
guide.introduction:
by Laurent Weichberger (Version 7 ~ Revised: Feb. 20, 2015)
This Couchbase Lite Tutorial is based on Android code written in Eclipse Kepler (IDE) on a MacBook Pro (16 GB RAM), with Couchbase Lite version 1.0.3.1. Throughout the tutorial we will reference screen shots and Java code. If you are using another OS, and IDE or language, we will share more about iOS/Xcode projects in a subsequent tutorial.

article.title: Setup your Environment for Success.
article.description: Create handle to Couchbase Lite database, init config.

introduction.paragraph: The first thing we need to do is get all of our software in place, and configured properly. We will be using the Couchbase Lite 1.0.3 download, as well as Eclipse and Android. Some of the jar files will need to be moved to their proper places after download, so we have given you step by step instructions on how to install all the software properly before we start developing.

ordered-list.list-item: Make sure Eclipse 4.4.x or more recent is being used.
Within Eclipse use the menu option: Help > Install New Software to install the “ADT Plugin” for Android development: https://dl-ssl.google.com/android/eclipse/
If you have difficulty with this step, go here: http://developer.android.com/sdk/installing/installing­adt.html
If you do this properly, you will have a new selection from the menu in Eclipse > Window > Android SDK Manager:
Find Android 4.4.2 (API 19) in the list and click the checkboxes for:SDK Platform & ARM EABI v7a System Image & Google APIs (ARM System Image), and click “Install Packages”:

Next you will need an Android Virtual Device (AVD):
Go to Eclipse > Window >Android Virtual Device Manager and click on “Create,” to create the AVD with a target of 4.4.2. Click OK and then Start the AVD, which should run as something like this on your desktop:

topic.title: Next we need to grab the Couchbase Lite SDK.

ordered-list.list-item: Download Couchbase Lite v. 1.0.3.1 or more recent: navigate to: http://www.couchbase.com/nosql-databases/downloads#Couchbase_Mobile

topic.title: Download the Sync Gateway v. 1.0.3. or more recent:

ordered-list.list-item: The download file once extracted will contain: We will be using the Sync Gateway later in the tutorial, so stand by for further instructions, now that you have it downloaded.
